author: Firoz Rozindar
text:
The police have arrested Khalil Yehadalli (30), a native of Kerur village of Bagalkot taluk in Karnataka, on charges of circulating objectionable and derogatory photo of RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat. He has been remanded in judicial custody.

According to police, the arrest was made on Sunday after pro-Hindu activists filed a complaint accusing Yehadalli of hurting the religious sentiments.

Speaking to The Hindu , sub-inspector of Kerur police station S.M. Awagi said the accused has been arrested under Section 295 (A) of the Indian Penal Code for deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage religious feelings or any class by insulting its religion or religious beliefs, and Section 66,67 of the IT Act.

Meanwhile, on Monday, the Hindu Jagaran Vedike too submitted a memorandum to the police, condemning the act and demanding stringent punishment to the accused.
title: Man arrested for circulating objectionable photos of RSS chief
